articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A bomb blast in Tel Aviv late on Sunday has been confirmed as a terrorist attack, Israeli police and the Shin Bet domestic intelligence agency said on Monday.
articles.title: Deadly bomb blast in Tel Aviv was a terrorist attack, Israeli police say

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Moscow said on Monday Ukraine had struck a third bridge in an assault on Russia's Kursk region which Kyiv says is aimed at carving out a buffer zone and wearing down Russia's war machine.
articles.title: Russia says Ukraine has hit third bridge in assault on Kursk region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One person died and six people were missing after a luxury yacht was struck by a whirlwind and sank off the coast of the Sicilian capital Palermo, Italian media reported.
articles.title: One reported dead, six missing after yacht sinks off Sicily

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas senior official Osama Hamdan criticized U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken's statement on Monday that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accepted an updated proposal, saying it "raises many ambiguities" because it is "not what was presented to us nor what we agreed on."
articles.title: Senior Hamas official criticizes Blinken's Gaza proposal claim

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. State Department condemned "dangerous actions" by China on Monday against Philippine vessels in the South China Sea.
articles.title: US condemns 'dangerous actions' by China against Philippine vessels

articles.author: Subrata Nag Choudhury
articles.description: Thousands of Indian junior doctors on Monday refused to end protests over the rape and murder of a fellow medic, disrupting hospital services nearly a week since they launched a nation-wide action demanding safer workplace and swift criminal action.
articles.title: Indian medics refuse to end protests over doctor's rape and murder

articles.author: Lisa Richwine
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump has posted a fake social media image of pop superstar Taylor Swift asking people to vote for him in the November election.
articles.title: Trump posts image of fake Taylor Swift endorsement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Department of State has approved the possible sale of Javelin missiles and related equipment to Australia for estimated cost of $100 million, the Pentagon said on Monday.
articles.title: US approves possible sale of Javelin missiles to Australia, Pentagon says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A judge on Monday denied a bid by U.S. President Joe Biden's son, Hunter, to dismiss a federal tax evasion case brought against him in California.
articles.title: Hunter Biden loses bid to toss tax evasion case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States on Monday accused Iran of launching cyber operations against the campaigns of both U.S. presidential candidates and targeting the American public with influence operations aimed at fanning political discord.
articles.title: U.S. says Iran cyber operations targeted Trump, Harris campaigns
